intro: Scaevola kilaueae var. powersii, commonly known as the Kilauea scaevola, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of the Hawaiian Islands. Its foliage is often grayish-green, and it produces small, round leaves. This variant is named after the botanist Robert Powers, who contributed to its classification.
